member.name: F:NuGet.Configuration.CredentialRequestType.Proxy
member.summary: Indicates that the request credentials are to be used to access a proxy.

member.name: F:NuGet.Configuration.CredentialRequestType.Unauthorized
member.summary: Indicates that the remote server rejected the previous request as unauthorized. This suggests that the server does not know who the caller is (i.e. the caller is not authenticated).

member.name: F:NuGet.Configuration.CredentialRequestType.Forbidden
member.summary: Indicates that the remote server rejected the previous request as forbidden. This suggests that the server knows who the caller is (i.e. the caller is authorized) but is not allowed to access the request resource. A different set of credentials could solve this failure.

member.name: T:NuGet.Configuration.ICredentialService
member.summary: A credentials service.

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.ICredentialService.GetCredentialsAsync(System.Uri,System.Net.IWebProxy,NuGet.Configuration.CredentialRequestType,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously gets credentials.
member.param: The URI for which credentials should be retrieved.
A web proxy.
The credential request type.
A message to display when prompting for credentials.
A cancellation token.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result () returns a .

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.ICredentialService.TryGetLastKnownGoodCredentialsFromCache(System.Uri,System.Boolean,System.Net.ICredentials@)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve last known good credentials for a URI from a credentials cache.
member.remarks: When the return value is true, will have last known good credentials from the credentials cache. These credentials may have become invalid since their last use, so there is no guarantee that the credentials are currently valid.
member.param: The URI for which cached credentials should be retrieved.
true for proxy credentials; otherwise, false.
Cached credentials or null.
member.returns: true if a result is returned from the cache; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.ICredentialService.HandlesDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this credential service wants to handle "default credentials" specially, instead of relying on DefaultNetworkCredentials

member.name: F:NuGet.Configuration.NuGetConstants.DefaultGalleryServerUrl
member.summary: NuGet.org gallery Url used as a source display name and as a default "id" when storing nuget.org API key.
member.remarks: Albeit this url is not actual feed we should keep it unchanged for back-compat with earlier NuGet versions. Typical scenario leading to adding this url to config file is to run setApiKey command without a source: nuget.exe setApiKey XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX

member.summary: Indicates if password is stored in clear text.

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceCredential.ValidAuthenticationTypes
member.summary: List of authentication types the credential is valid for, e.g. 'basic'. If empty, all authentication types are allowed.

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceCredential.ValidAuthenticationTypesText
member.summary: Comma-delimited list of authentication types the credential is valid for as stored in the config file. If null or empty, all authentication types are valid. Example: 'basic,negotiate'

member.returns: True if credentials object is valid

member.summary: Instantiates the credential instance out of raw values read from a config file.

User name
Password as stored in config file
Hints if password provided in clear text
Comma-delimited list of authentication types the credential is valid for as stored in the config file. If null or empty, all authentication types are valid. Example: 'basic,negotiate'

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceCredential.FromUserInput(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Creates new instance of credential object out values provided by user.

User name
Password text in clear
Hints if the password should be stored in clear text on disk.
Comma-delimited list of authentication types the credential is valid for as stored in the config file. If null or empty, all authentication types are valid. Example: 'basic,negotiate'
member.returns: New instance of

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceCredential.ToICredentials
member.summary: Converts this object to an ICredentials, capturing the username, password and valid authentication types

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceCredential.ParseAuthTypeFilterString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts an authentication type filter string from the config file syntax to a list of valid authentication types
member.param: Comma-delimited list of authentication types the credential is valid for as stored in the config file. If null or empty, all authentication types are valid. Example: 'basic,negotiate'

member.summary: Adds or updates the given to the settings. If the has to be added this method will add it in the user wide settings file, or walk down the hierarchy (starting from the user wide config) until it finds a config where the given section is not cleared.
member.param: section where the has to be added. If this section does not exist, one will be created.
item to be added to the settings.

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.ISettings.Remove(System.String,NuGet.Configuration.SettingItem)
member.summary: Removes the given from the settings. If the is the last item in the section, the section will also be removed. If the item is overriding any items from other configs it will delete all the merged items that are not in a machine wide config.
member.param: Section where the is stored. If this section does not exist, the method will throw
item to be removed from the settings
member.remarks: If the is in a machine wide config this method will throw

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.ISettings.SaveToDisk
member.summary: Flushes any update that has been done in memory through the ISettings API to the settings file in disk.

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.ISettings.GetConfigFilePaths

member.name: T:NuGet.Configuration.CredentialsItem
member.summary: A CredentialsItem has a name and it can have between 2 or 3 children: - [Required] Username (AddItem) - [Required] Either Password or ClearTextPassword (AddItem) - [Optional] ValidAuthenticationTypes (AddItem)

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.CredentialsItem.Update(NuGet.Configuration.SettingItem)
member.remarks: This method is internal because it updates directly the xElement behind this abstraction. It should only be called whenever the underlaying config file is intended to be changed. To persist changes to disk one must save the corresponding setting files

member.name: T:NuGet.Configuration.FileClientCertItem
member.summary: A FileClientCertItem have 4 attributes: - [Required] packageSource - [Required] path - [Optional] password - [Optional] clearTextPassword

member.name: T:NuGet.Configuration.PackagePatternItem

member.name: T:NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceMappingSourceItem

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.PackageSourceMappingSourceItem.Key

member.name: T:NuGet.Configuration.StoreClientCertItem
member.summary: A StoreClientCertItem have 4 Attributes: - [Required] packageSource - [Optional] storeLocation. StoreLocation.CurrentUser by default. - [Optional] storeName. StoreName.My by default. - [Optional] findBy. X509FindType.FindByThumbprint by default. - [Required] findValue

member.summary: Load settings based on the solution or project root directory. NuGet.Config files will be discovered based on this path. The machine wide config will also be loaded.

member.summary: Convenience method to add an element to an origin. Since an origin should not be updated, any update will be ignored.

member.summary: Text that differentiates element tag

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.SettingElement.AllowedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the keys for the attributes that the element can have
member.remarks: If null then all attributes are allowed

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.SettingElement.RequiredAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the keys for the attributes that the element should have
member.remarks: If null or empty then no attributes are required

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.SettingElement.AllowedValues
member.summary: Specifies which values are allowed for a specific attribute. If an attribute is not defined every value is allowed. Having allowed values does not imply that the attribute is required.

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.SettingElement.DisallowedValues
member.summary: Specifies values that are explicitely disallowed for a specific attribute. If an attribute is not defined no value is disallowed. Having disallowed values does not imply that the attribute is required.

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.SettingElement.MutableAttributes
member.summary: Key-value pairs that give more information about the element

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.SettingElement.Attributes
member.summary: Read only key-value pairs that give more information about the element

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.SettingElement.IsEmpty
member.summary: Specifies if the element is empty. Each element defines its own definition of empty. The default definition of empty is an element without attributes.

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.Settings.LoadDefaultSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Load default settings based on a directory. This includes machine wide settings.

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.Settings.LoadDefaultSettings(System.String,System.String,NuGet.Configuration.IMachineWideSettings)
member.summary: Loads user settings from the NuGet configuration files. The method walks the directory tree in up to its root, and reads each NuGet.config file it finds in the directories. It then reads the user specific settings, which is file in if is not null, If is null, the user specific settings file is %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config. After that, the machine wide settings files are added.
member.remarks:
For example, if is c:\dir1\dir2, is "userConfig.file", the files loaded are (in the order that they are loaded): c:\dir1\dir2
uget.config c:\dir1
uget.config c:
uget.config c:\dir1\dir2\userConfig.file machine wide settings (e.g. c:\programdata\NuGet\Config\*.config)
member.param: The file system to walk to find configuration files. Can be null.
The user specified configuration file.
The machine wide settings. If it's not null, the settings files in the machine wide settings are added after the user specific config file.
member.returns: The settings object loaded.

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.Settings.LoadDefaultSettings(System.String,System.String,NuGet.Configuration.IMachineWideSettings,NuGet.Configuration.SettingsLoadingContext)
member.summary: Loads user settings from the NuGet configuration files. The method walks the directory tree in up to its root, and reads each NuGet.config file it finds in the directories. It then reads the user specific settings, which is file in if is not null, If is null, the user specific settings file is %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config. After that, the machine wide settings files are added.
member.remarks:
For example, if is c:\dir1\dir2, is "userConfig.file", the files loaded are (in the order that they are loaded): c:\dir1\dir2
uget.config c:\dir1
uget.config c:
uget.config c:\dir1\dir2\userConfig.file machine wide settings (e.g. c:\programdata\NuGet\Config\*.config)
member.param: The file system to walk to find configuration files. Can be null.
The user specified configuration file.
The machine wide settings. If it's not null, the settings files in the machine wide settings are added after the user specific config file.
A object to use when loading the settings.
member.returns: The settings object loaded.

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.Settings.LoadSpecificSettings(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Loads Specific NuGet.Config file. The method only loads specific config file which is file from .

member.summary: For internal use only

member.summary: For internal use only. Finds and loads all configuration files within . Does not load configuration files outside of .

member.summary: Load the user specific settings

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.Settings.LoadMachineWideSettings(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Loads the machine wide settings.
member.remarks: For example, if is {"IDE", "Version", "SKU" }, then the files loaded are (in the order that they are loaded): %programdata%\NuGet\Config\IDE\Version\SKU\*.config %programdata%\NuGet\Config\IDE\Version\*.config %programdata%\NuGet\Config\IDE\*.config %programdata%\NuGet\Config\*.config
member.param: The file system in which the settings files are read.
The additional paths under which to look for settings files.
member.returns: The list of settings read.

member.summary: Get a list of all the paths of the settings files used as part of this settings object

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.Settings.GetConfigRoots
member.summary: Get a list of all the roots of the settings files used as part of this settings object

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.Settings.GetSettingsFilesFullPath(System.String)
member.remarks: Order is most significant (e.g. applied last) to least significant (applied first) ex: c:\someLocation\nuget.config c:\nuget.config

member.name: M:NuGet.Configuration.Settings.GetSettingsFileNameFromDir(System.String)
member.summary: Checks for each possible casing of nuget.config in the directory. The first match is returned. If there are no nuget.config files null is returned.
member.remarks: For windows contains a single casing since the file system is case insensitive.

member.name: P:NuGet.Configuration.SettingsFile.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Determines if the settings file is considered read-only from NuGet perspective.
member.remarks: User-wide configuration files imported from non-default locations are not considered editable. Note that this is different from . will return for every machine-wide config.

member.name: T:NuGet.StringBuilderPool
member.summary: Provides a resource pool that enables reusing instances of instances.

remarks.para: Renting and returning buffers with an can increase performance in situations where instances are created and destroyed frequently, resulting in significant memory pressure on the garbage collector.
This class is thread-safe. All members may be used by multiple threads concurrently.

member.name: F:NuGet.StringBuilderPool.Shared
member.summary: Retrieves a shared instance.

member.name: M:NuGet.StringBuilderPool.Rent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a that is at least the requested length.
member.param: The minimum capacity of the needed.
member.returns: A that is at least in length.
member.remarks: This buffer is loaned to the caller and should be returned to the same pool via so that it may be reused in subsequent usage of . It is not a fatal error to not return a rented string builder, but failure to do so may lead to decreased application performance, as the pool may need to create a new instance to replace the one lost.

member.name: M:NuGet.StringBuilderPool.Return(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Returns to the pool an array that was previously obtained via on the same instance.
member.param: The previously obtained from to return to the pool.
member.remarks: Once a has been returned to the pool, the caller gives up all ownership of the instance and must not use it. The reference returned from a given call to must only be returned via once. The default may hold onto the returned instance in order to rent it again, or it may release the returned instance if it's determined that the pool already has enough instances stored.
